cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles NNE of Tiburon, Haiti and 90 miles S of the eastern tip of Cuba (over the Gulf of Gonave)
cyclone.trajectory: moving north today, then turning north-northwest Wednesday and northwest Wednesday night, tracking through the Bahamas and paralleling the southeast Florida coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: possible close approach / landfall along the southeast Florida Atlantic coast near Palm Beach County

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Deerfield Beach to the Volusia/Brevard county line, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for Florida at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast and east-central Florida coastline, including Palm Beach County, as Matthew parallels the shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely, with hurricane-force gusts possible late Thursday into early Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential storm surge 3–5 ft above ground along the Palm Beach County coast if the center tracks close to shore.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches with locally up to 10 inches possible along the southeast Florida coast, including Port of Palm Beach.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and life-threatening rip currents; possible port-side flooding from heavy rain.
